question_text: A company maintains two fleets of laptops: one with user-swappable batteries and another with internal non-removable batteries. Select two key support implications of the internal battery design.
answer_options: Requires fewer technical staff for servicing
Demands longer repair times per incident
Allows faster power restoration in the field
Introduces downtime during scheduled battery replacements
Simplifies remote diagnostics of battery failures
correct_answer: Demands longer repair times per incident
Introduces downtime during scheduled battery replacements
explanation: Internal batteries complicate servicing, increasing downtime and technician workload compared to swappable battery models.
